user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of print_perf_warnings:
```c
static void
print_perf_warnings (void)
{
  int newline_needed = 0;
#if defined (_DEBUG)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: Running with debug asserts enabled, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && ! defined (__OPTIMIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled without enabled compiler "
           "optimisations, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && defined (__OPTIMIZE_SIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled with size-optimisations, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701
  if (MHD_NO != MHD_is_feature_supported (MHD_FEATURE_DEBUG_BUILD))
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The libmicrohttpd is compiled with "
             "debug asserts enabled, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
    newline_needed |=  ! 0;
  }
#endif /* MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701 */
  if (newline_needed)
    printf ("\n");
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The function print_perf_warnings has no parameters (signature: static void print_perf_warnings(void)), so MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 (a function parameter should not be modified) cannot be violated within this function. All assignments in the body (e.g. newline_needed |= !0) modify a local variable, not a parameter. Calls to fprintf and MHD_is_feature_supported pass pointers (stderr and string literals), but these are arguments to other functions and are not parameters of print_perf_warnings itself; this function does not modify any pointer parameters. Therefore there are no fragments in this code that need investigation for Rule 17.8.
